channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2697] Notebook [Pic]
[+2462] Westboro Baptist Church Pwned!
item.description: Phelps' gang were in San Francisco last Thursday "protesting" at the Twitter headquarters and were met by a large contingency of counter-protesters with some of the best signs I have seen in a long time. The counter protest was so successful that Westboro called off their second protest at a Fiddler on the Roof performance scheduled for later . .

item.title: [+2257] Best Warning EVER on a Video Game Box Art
[+1977] ...Your Chart's Upide Down... [comic]
[+1903] Stephen Colbert takes out an iPad at the Grammys!
item.description: Colbert took his iPad to the 52nd Annual Grammys. Nice product placement, Apple.

item.title: [+1713] Creator of 'Calvin and Hobbes' first interview in 15 years
item.description: "I just tried to write honestly, and I tried to make this little world fun to look at, so people would take the time to read it. That was the full extent of my concern. You mix a bunch of ingredients, and once in a great while, chemistry happens. I can't explain why the strip caught on the way it did, and I don't think I could ever duplicate it."

item.title: [+1611] Please Unsubscribe me from Your Internet (PIC)
item.description: It gets too full all the time

item.title: [+1293] Wrong place - Tough consequences
[+1215] States Ranked by 'Religiousness' (Graph)
item.description: While it can be argued that correlation does not imply causation, the trends revealed by these statistics, in relation to IQ, impoverishment, divorce, crime and political beliefs seem too consistent to refute. Data sources listed at bottom.

item.title: [+1122] 16 Year Old Invents Radio For Texting 1000 Feet Underground
item.description: Sixteen-year-old Alexander Kendrick has created a device that allows texting and other data transfer from almost 1000 feet underground. The tech could allow rapid emergency communication with the surface and opens the potential for scientific measurements without the need to continually visit (and disturb) the cave environment.

item.title: [+1055] THE UGLIEST WEBSITE ON THE ENTIRE INTERNETS!
item.description: Ladies and Gentlemen, Madames et Monsieurs, Damen und Herren...I give you, without a doubt, the ugliest website on the entire internets. It's as if Myspace barfed on Geocities. Don't stare too long, you're likely to cause retinal damage.

item.title: [+999] uTorrent Spreads Its Wings With Falcon
item.description: In all the years it’s been available, uTorrent hasn’t changed as much as it will with the upcoming release. Codenamed Falcon, the client will have an easier, more secure and more complete web UI as well as support for streaming and remote downloading.

item.title: [+975] Lazy...or Efficient? (GIF)
item.description: This glass cleaner on a moving walkway seems to have the right idea.

item.title: [+864] Taylor Swift Drops & Breaks Grammy Award
item.description: Taylor Swift had the best problem any singer could have on Sunday. The singer, in the press room at the 52nd Grammy Awards, couldn't keep a hold of the four gramophone statuettes she received, dropping one to the ground -- breaking it.

item.title: [+836] A meme's effect on a human being [PIC]
[+826] Tunnel of Terror [Gif]
[+790] 16 games that are going to blow you visually in 2010
item.description: 2009 was an amazing year with jaw dropping games like Uncharted 2: Among Thieves, but it looks like 2010 is going to be another graphically rich year with some stunning games coming out for each console. Here we take a look at sixteen games that are going to blow you visually in 2010, in no particular order.

item.title: [+725] 25 Movies So Bad They're Unmissable
item.description: Horrible! Utterly horrible! And yet, fascinating... What makes a film so appalling that it transitions from ordinary ineptitude into the sublime; beyond cult status (and all reason) and into that surreal place where you really can't believe what you're watching?

item.title: [+710] Happy cat with three tomatoes [PIC]
[+701] How Canadians Drink Milk
